input_text:
Job Title: Diesel Fleet Mechanic

Location: Naples, ID

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job DescriptionJob DescriptionPosition Title: Diesel Fleet Mechanic

Location: Naples, FL

Job Category: Field Employee

Salary Interval: Full-Time

Quality Enterprises USA, Inc., a leading heavy civil construction company, is seeking a Heavy Equipment Mechanic to perform maintenance, diagnosis, and repairs on company equipment and heavy machinery in a safe, efficient, and quality-focused manner at their Naples, FL location.

Benefits

Competitive PayPaid Holidays and PTOMedical & Dental InsuranceLife Insurance (Company Paid)401(k) with Matching Company Contributions

Responsibilities

Perform repair work on company vehicles and trailers.Diagnose and perform repairs according to manufacturer’s specifications on engines, transmissions and clutches, suspension and steering, fuel and ignition (gas and diesel), electrical systems, brakes, and HVAC systems, etc.Follow paper-flow procedures for: documenting correct mileage/ hours at time of repair, save and tag all warranty and core parts, document all repairs on work orders, and follow parts ordering procedures.Perform final operational test on all vehicles to quality-check repairs.Complete required inspections and preventative maintenance on vehicles to maximize the safety, productivity, and lifespan. This includes: DOT inspections, fluid changes, lubrications, safety inspections, and brake repairs.Craft thorough reports and records in a timely manner and provide final documentation of all repairs. Additionally, submit parts requisition forms to purchasing agent.Participate in general shop operations and maintain a clean and safe work environment.

Required Experience & Skills

Experience with Dodge and Honda .Experience with Kenworth a plusAbility to work independently, establish and follow schedule of preventative maintenance inspections, and make all adjustments and repairs as required.Fleet or automotive maintenance experience and DOT certification required.Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs., have a valid Class E license and DOT physical card (or ability to obtain), and pass a pre-employment drug test.Works well in a fast-paced, demanding team environment.Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, streamline work processes and work cooperatively with a team.

Quality Enterprises USA, Inc. (QE) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to , , , , , , status, genetics, protected veteran status, , or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

PIe716ebe7bbdb-25405-29979871

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
